TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CursorConverter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert objects to and from various other representations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and "Implementing a Type Converter".
> [!NOTE] > You should never create an instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.CursorConverter> class. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.

Docs.param: A formatter context. This object can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This may be , so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return .
The type you wish to convert from.
Docs.summary: Determines if this converter can convert an object in the given source type to the native type of the converter.
Docs.returns: if this object can perform the conversion.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object to the given destination type using the context.
Docs.returns: if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `context` parameter can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This can be `null`, so always check. Also, properties on the context object can return `null`.

block.para: Override this method to provide your own conversion requirements.

Docs.param: A formatter context. This object can be used to extract additional information about the environment this converter is being invoked from. This may be , so you should always check. Also, properties on the context object may also return .
Docs.summary: Retrieves a collection containing a set of standard values for the data type this validator is designed for. This will return if the data type does not support a standard set of values.
Docs.returns: A collection containing a standard set of valid values, or . The default implementation always returns .

Docs.param: A type descriptor through which additional context may be provided.
Docs.summary: Determines if this object supports a standard set of values that can be picked from a list.
Docs.returns: Returns if should be called to find a common set of values the object supports.
